content:
Nice clash.

One thing that's not clear in the statement or constraints is whether overlapping matches on a single line should be counted separately.
e.g.
EYE
5
5
EYEYE
YEYEY
EYEYE
YEYEY
EYEYE

Your code would output "8" as the answer here, but if overlapping answers on the same line were allowed, the answer would be "16". (https://i.imgur.com/qYQGTIO.png)

I think it's important for clashers to know that such overlaps are not counted and are in fact never going to appear in tests or validators. This helps avoid clashers going overboard to solve a harder problem than intended, or wasting time checking the test cases to see if such things appear since the statement doesn't clarify.

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear statement, easy to solve

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Really easy and simple to understand. Easy to solve in under 5 minutes. Good job

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Clear and trivial description, short and simple clash

Please follow the example in the contribution guidelines to format the variables in all sections and rewrite your Input section.
https://www.codingame.com/playgrounds/40701/help-center/statement#guidelines
Thanks.

A simple line to clarify these cases won't be tested would be:

"There will <<never>> be any tests with overlapping occurences in the same line: e.g. {{EYEYE}} for the word {{EYE}}."

Could add that to Constraints and/or Statement.
